intro: Cynanchum darvasicum, commonly known as the Darvasian dogbane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually greenish-white in color. Cynanchum darvasicum is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
